channel.title: What Makes you feel welcome?
channel.description: Well I've started my PI project, and I want to know from you guys, what you like to see when you log on to an rsps for the first time. Just voice your opinions so I can get a good idea of what to add.

item.title: What Makes you feel welcome?
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

Not logging into a PI server.

Make it customized or it sucks in my opinion.

Read full topic

[quote=“imsuperman05, post:31, topic:414388”][quote author=tyb97 link=topic=516351.msg3747690#msg3747690 date=1315788113]

no donator benefits. only donations for the server that are really needed from people who get nothing in return from the donations.

Yeah I am thinking of something like, Respect Points, like you can earn them from staff, and you get some as long as you aren’t causing a bunch of problems throughout the game, and party hats will serve as indicators of how respected you are… but this is just an idea I just had…
[/quote]
lolol im gonna steal it cuz its a good idea. And make party hats and respected stuff nontradeable.[/quote]
Lol idc… if you post your stuff on a server or forum, its gonna get stolen.

item.title: What Makes you feel welcome?
item.dc:creator: @demps2k9 demps2k9
item.description:
@demps2k9 wrote:

Here are a few more.

  1. Have the correct teleports, with the correct level requirements.
  2. Same areas as RS such as Taverly dungeon and Varrock sewers but maybe with the exception of different monsters ranging from low levels to higher levels the further into the dungeons/sewers you go. Same with the wilderness monsters etc too.
  3. Correct attack and block animations for weapons, characters and npcs.

Read full topic

I made my welcome message tell the date

Nice superman

My you do an emote and GFX and force text says “Im Back Guys!”
Then a custom interface pops up telling several different information.
Such as days of membership left: if your a donator or not then a donate button (i had too :/)
a random tip and then what status your accounts in green yellow red depending on how many “black marks” or “warnings” you have. not the MOST original thing but pretty up there!

item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

[quote=“tyb97, post:20, topic:414388”][quote author=eballer48 link=topic=516351.msg3747589#msg3747589 date=1315784846]

Very advanced @The Wanderer… I have a different plan tho… but I’m still writing it down, it’s not finished yet…
@runescape sucks
I assure you, I am doing this for learning coding, no profit for me will be involved.

Mmmk and another thing…
“Welcome to blah**blah
Join the forums
Enjoy your time
blah
blah
blah
blah”

So yeah… more like

“Welcome to blah**blah”

What? lol

What he means is like 90% of servers when you login say…

“Welcome to extremeAwesome Scape!
Forums: gayassname.smfforfree.com
Owner: ImGayAsFuck
Remember to donate!”

Be original.
[/quote]
Oh lol, I assure you, my basis is to make a place to play a game, and have fun, not just out to make money… I hate servers that you have to donate or vote to get the good stuff…[/quote]
The server im playing on right now has something similar to that lol

Welcome to * There are currently * players online. Enjoy your stay. Please type ::commands. PLEASE READ THE ::RULES Visit www.*.com for * and more!

  • = things i didnt type

Read full topic

item.title: What Makes you feel welcome?
item.dc:creator: @belhelmiel belhelmiel
item.description:
@belhelmiel wrote:

A few people standing around having a conversation, people to talk to, a starter kit, medium exp rates, something different, an awesome home, no lagging, something really fun to do as soon as you start like a really fun short optional tutorial that gives you a nice little reward at the end. 1 or 2 little newbie monsters. Not too much crowded stuff so it’s not overwhelming. Rules list so I don’t get banned for something I didn’t no was against the rules. A few moderators in case I need to report any bugs to them. But make sure there’s a rule against bugging moderators over stupid stuff so that the moderators don’t quit. A nice beginner look so that I don’t look like some random guy who’s dressed up for a mexican festival. (not racist or anything im 8th mexican) Make a chill zone thats easy to get to and better than home for just chilling add 2-3 monsters there so that more people are attracted to there so that home isn’t super crowded and it doesn’t look overwhelming. Not to many things moving fast like a bunch portals going in circles super fast. Maybe one or 2 just for decoration. A really nice welcome message so they feel more comfortable playing the game.

Read full topic

item.title: What Makes you feel welcome?
item.dc:creator: @Coder_Eddie Coder Eddie
item.description:
@Coder_Eddie wrote:

[quote=“tyb97, post:12, topic:414388”][quote author=Coder Eddie link=topic=516351.msg3747550#msg3747550 date=1315783386]
something that others server dont have and lots to explore and something different to do and decent xp rates and stable econemy with no resets,good luck
[/quote]
Yeah, I’m going to remove all the teleports to everywhere, and think of more creative ways to travel, I’ve already been thinking of a system of getting places.[/quote]

dont need to remove the teleports just like add instead of like mining tele,smithing, add like skilling area,make like a monster island or slayer island instead of slayer tower,be a little creative and add some inferences do updates once in a while,good luck

Read full topic

item.title: What Makes you feel welcome?
item.dc:creator: @eballer48 eballer48
item.description:
@eballer48 wrote:

[quote=“The Wanderer, post:14, topic:414388”][quote author=tyb97 link=topic=516351.msg3747514#msg3747514 date=1315782196]
Thanks, what is your opinion on how long it should take to reach maximum level on a skill? Right now I’m working out the bugs but the max level for all skills is 125, I plan to have the skill cape stay at 99 but unlock something special at 125.
[/quote]
My little concept I had a while ago. And you get level 125 at like around 190m exp or so, so it is similar.

[quote=The Wanderer]First off this was concepted for a 317 server. When you reach 200,000,000 experience in a skill you would be given the opportunity at your will to teleport to the RuneScape’s God’s Temple and receive a God Cape of Accomplishment in said skill. You get to decide which god you receive it from, but it doesn’t matter. Each god is sitting in a throne. With these capes comes a new set of emotes and effects. Effects affect your gameplay whether you are wearing the cape or not.

Attack:
Emote: Does two roundhouse kicks in succession and then jumps in the air. Your character seems to float there as he does multiple superman punches. Then he lands on his feet and it is over. Each kick/punch would have flames around them almost like they are breaking the sound barrier.
Effect: Never ever hits a 0 with melee attacks.

Strength:
Emote: Pick up a huge boulder and throws it/picks up the world and carries it on his back.
Effect: 10% chance of hitting double your max hit.

Defence:
Emote: Arrow flies at the character and the character simply catches it with both of his hands like praying and tosses it aside. A magic fireball is blasted at the character and he brushes it aside. A boulder is hurled and the character and he crosses his arms in front of his face and the boulder smashes to dust on impact.
Effect: 25% chance of reducing a hit by half

Ranged:
Emote: Shoots an arrow high up into the sky and as it comes down he shoots another arrow and break the arrow descending in half.
Effect: Never hit a 0 with ranged weapons.

Magic:
Emote: Shoots an air blast similar to air surge, then causes a mini wave to come from the side, then causes a huge pillar of Earth to rise from the ground, then a wall of fire surrounds the player.
Effect: Half of runes are required for spells.

Prayer:
Emote: Character clasps his hands together and bows his head, and a aura seems to envelop the character. A sword is swung at the player but is recoiled by the aura. Three arrows are shot at the player, but the aura acts as a shield and they clatter to the ground. A magic fireball is casted at the player and it seems to envelop the player, but the player is left unscathed because the aura acted as a shield. The player unclasps his hands and looks up. The aura seems to dissipate and a shadowy figure is seen above him, watching over him.
Effects:1/2 of prayer points consumed while praying.

(I’m going to skip a few skills and put blanks later as typing on a small iPod with big fingers is annoying. I’ll only put the ones down I have emotes for now.)

Agility:
Emote: Does a barrellroll and then does two back flips in one jump.
Effect: unlimited running

Slayer:
Emote: Tussels with a dark beast barehandedly, finally grabs it by the heand and slams it into the ground. Then the player places one foot on the dark beast like a captain Morgan pose.
Effect: Requires no slayer equipment and slayer monster effects are useless.

That’s all of the skills I thought up while concepting this idea. Hopefully this will inspire one of you to finish what I never accomplished.[/quote][/quote]

I really like all your work bro
Your quote inspired me alot aswell.
Added 2 respected list.

Read full topic

item.title: What Makes you feel welcome?
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

tyb97:

Thanks, what is your opinion on how long it should take to reach maximum level on a skill? Right now I’m working out the bugs but the max level for all skills is 125, I plan to have the skill cape stay at 99 but unlock something special at 125.

My little concept I had a while ago. And you get level 125 at like around 190m exp or so, so it is similar.

First off this was concepted for a 317 server. When you reach 200,000,000 experience in a skill you would be given the opportunity at your will to teleport to the RuneScape's God's Temple and receive a God Cape of Accomplishment in said skill. You get to decide which god you receive it from, but it doesn't matter. Each god is sitting in a throne. With these capes comes a new set of emotes and effects. Effects affect your gameplay whether you are wearing the cape or not.

Attack:
Emote: Does two roundhouse kicks in succession and then jumps in the air. Your character seems to float there as he does multiple superman punches. Then he lands on his feet and it is over. Each kick/punch would have flames around them almost like they are breaking the sound barrier.
Effect: Never ever hits a 0 with melee attacks.

Strength:
Emote: Pick up a huge boulder and throws it/picks up the world and carries it on his back.
Effect: 10% chance of hitting double your max hit.

Defence:
Emote: Arrow flies at the character and the character simply catches it with both of his hands like praying and tosses it aside. A magic fireball is blasted at the character and he brushes it aside. A boulder is hurled and the character and he crosses his arms in front of his face and the boulder smashes to dust on impact.
Effect: 25% chance of reducing a hit by half

Ranged:
Emote: Shoots an arrow high up into the sky and as it comes down he shoots another arrow and break the arrow descending in half.
Effect: Never hit a 0 with ranged weapons.

Magic:
Emote: Shoots an air blast similar to air surge, then causes a mini wave to come from the side, then causes a huge pillar of Earth to rise from the ground, then a wall of fire surrounds the player.
Effect: Half of runes are required for spells.

Prayer:
Emote: Character clasps his hands together and bows his head, and a aura seems to envelop the character. A sword is swung at the player but is recoiled by the aura. Three arrows are shot at the player, but the aura acts as a shield and they clatter to the ground. A magic fireball is casted at the player and it seems to envelop the player, but the player is left unscathed because the aura acted as a shield. The player unclasps his hands and looks up. The aura seems to dissipate and a shadowy figure is seen above him, watching over him.
Effects:1/2 of prayer points consumed while praying.

(I’m going to skip a few skills and put blanks later as typing on a small iPod with big fingers is annoying. I’ll only put the ones down I have emotes for now.)

Agility:
Emote: Does a barrellroll and then does two back flips in one jump.
Effect: unlimited running

Slayer:
Emote: Tussels with a dark beast barehandedly, finally grabs it by the heand and slams it into the ground. Then the player places one foot on the dark beast like a captain Morgan pose.
Effect: Requires no slayer equipment and slayer monster effects are useless.

That’s all of the skills I thought up while concepting this idea. Hopefully this will inspire one of you to finish what I never accomplished.

Read full topic
